website_summaries.verdict: We like the clean, simple line of the extremely versatile Spiralizer apple peeler.
pros: Also peels potatoes, squash, and other popular vegetables
Does not require much hand strength
It's not quite as heavy as the cast iron contenders
cons: Peeling function can stop working unexpectedly

customer_reviews.title: Effective!
customer_reviews.text: I love it! It's exactly what I wanted and bought it for myself as an early Christmas gift. I didn't know exactly how to use it but there are youtube videos showing exactly how to use it safely and effectively. It's awesome!! I can now peel veggies and fruits in 3 seconds flat - AND CORE THEM TOO. I love it! The suction cup is really sturdy and helpful. It will become a permanent fixture in our kitchen. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: M. H.

customer_reviews.title: Best invention ever
customer_reviews.text: Best invention ever! I was hesitant to buy one as I didn't think they really worked. This is amazing and it slices the apples too! It took me 1-2 minutes to peel, core, slice 5 large apples. Easy! Made a tart in a few minutes with uniform size apples. The only thing that would be helpful is if the directions were clearer - this will peel/core only, but I can't understand how to set that up.
customer_reviews.author: Jen53014

customer_reviews.title: Fell apart - *see update*
customer_reviews.text: The handle never worked properly. The handle has stripped out and fallen off and no longer stays on. Blade slips out of place easily. Would NOT recommend this product. UPDATE: Originally gave it 2 stars. Updated to 4 stars. Still waiting to see the durability it has. Was contacted shortly after posting review. They replaced the product quite quickly. When it arrived, this one seemed to be much better quality than prevoius one. Handle was much tighter. Already used it several times (probably close to a bushel of apples) and quite pleased with the replacement so far. Wonderful customer service who wants to make sure their customers are pleased with their products. Thank you for great customer service!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I bought this apple peeler because it looked sturdy and it is
customer_reviews.text: I had a bushel of apples to process and didn't want to do it all by hand. I bought this apple peeler because it looked sturdy and it is!!! The suction clamp lever very securely holds the peeler to the counter and stays put throughout the entire operation one apple after the other. It takes a quick swish in soapy water and a rinse to clean it and takes up very little space to store. Highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: chappytrails

customer_reviews.title: will try again
customer_reviews.text: returned ...did not work well..I have used Apple Peelers before ...and this one was made cheap. UPDATE: I was contacted from the company rep. Diane.. I may have received a lemon...it happens .. but what I was impressed with was the fact they wanted to make it right and send me a new one even through I had already received a refund...this is a small family business and I am sure they cannot afford to replace items all the time..but they did it anyway...this is a company I want to back.. and I will try again.. I own a small cottage business myself ..and so impressed by this..
customer_reviews.author: C. T. Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Should have bought one long ago!
customer_reviews.text: Should have bought one long ago--it would have saved countless hours. This thing is fantastic. Gone are the days of using a paring knife or vegetable peeler to prepare apples. In no time at all and with virtually no effort, it will peel, core, and slice an apple. The sliced apples are ready for pies, crisps, or applesauce. It seems sturdy enough that with a little care it will last for a long time. Even better, the website for spiralizer (spiralizer.us) says that their products have lifetime guarantees.
customer_reviews.author: RiverRat

customer_reviews.title: I'd rate it at 5 Stars as it does a great job peeling
customer_reviews.text: Just used it for the first time. I'd rate it at 5 Stars as it does a great job peeling, coring, and slicing apples all in one quick operation. I went through a 5 gal. bucket of apples for Mickey D's style deep fried apple pies in no time and would highly recommend it. Well made, all metal construction and the suction base really sticks to the countertop. Tip: After processing the apple do any trimming needed before popping out the core.
customer_reviews.author: cap

customer_reviews.title: It did not last more than 3 uses.
customer_reviews.text: I am a preschool teacher and bought this to make apple sauce and fruit salad with the kids. It’s design allows them to peel the apple safely (no knives). But after 3 uses, it is mot coring my apples and pretty much mashing them into the blade and notcoring or slicing. I have looked at the directions, and tried to readjust the blade but to no avail. I though maybe because the apples were bigger that was the problem but it is destroying all apples I put in it. I was so disappointed and so were my kids.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine Piwowarczyk

customer_reviews.title: This thing works great! My only complaint is that it won't stay ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing works great! My only complaint is that it won't stay suctioned on. As soon as the apple juice starts getting your counter wet, you'll have to move this thing to a dry spot. I sure hope it holds up and lasts a long time!
customer_reviews.author: A. Funk

customer_reviews.title: No more hand cramps from hand peeling and cutting :)
customer_reviews.text: I had a huge tree of apples needing prepped for canning for apple sauce and felt daunted after doing my pear tree. My hand hurt and cramped so I decided why suffer when I could buy this product. I am excited to try it and look forward to it. It is going to be put to the test. I will add pics and a proper review after I take on my loaded apple tree :) Added my pictures! Worked great. Love this peeler!!!
customer_reviews.author: Weller

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 7 apples
customer_reviews.text: This product worked great for the first seven apples. Then a screw under the base came loose and fell out. The screw has no nut or washer with it, so it won’t stay screwed. Ten minutes into using it, the product was rendered useless. Too bad, because I have 150 MORE APPLES I HAVE TO PEEL.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie M Ash

customer_reviews.title: Great tool, time saver
customer_reviews.text: Great tool. I really find it useful for peeling apples, of course, but also for peeling potatoes and some other root vegetables. I give it a 5 star rating because it does what it's advertised to do very well. The only root vegetable I've had problems with are sweet potatoes. They are always difficult to peel because they're outer skin and flesh are so hard. With this peeler I've had moderate success peeling them. It works better than a hand peeler.
customer_reviews.author: KZ

customer_reviews.title: It worked great until the suction gave out
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because my husband’s favorite dessert is apple pie. He was so excited about it that he prepared all the apples for his birthday pies. It was quick and easy until he got to the last two apples when the suction failed. He tried putting it on different surfaces but nothing worked. I had looked forward to having many years of easy apple pie prep and I am very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: There must be better products out there
customer_reviews.text: This does not peel apples! It spirals and Cote’s them but the peeler is too weak to slice through the skin. I have to peel the apple first, then put it on this thing but because I’ve removed the skin it slices through the meat of the fruit easily and creates a big wet mess. It’s hard to clean, and the suction doesn’t always work either.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer W.

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Used this item twice and is useless now. Suction cup will no longer adhere to counter.
customer_reviews.author: A.L.M.

customer_reviews.title: Fell apart
customer_reviews.text: The slicer mechanism came apart from the base on the third use. The two tiny screws used to hold the two parts together are a joke. I have to find replacement screws or better yet, buy a different slicer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: VERY DISAPPOINTED!
customer_reviews.text: The suction worked until I needed to "eject" the apple and core....a fight all the way. I should have gotten the clamp-on model My ancient apple-peeler finally gave up the ghost, or I would have even switched back to it because this was such an ordeal and I have so many apples.
customer_reviews.author: Phlyer

customer_reviews.title: Do not waste your money
customer_reviews.text: This is not work. The suction was very poor And had to hold the machine with one hand. It does not work on potatoes unless they are all exactly the same size and shape. Any slight irregularity and it does not get peeled. It actually only peels approximately 40% Of the items that you are peeling. Do not buy this product you are wasting your money.
customer_reviews.author: Peachie from Philly

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: Piece of crap. The blade is not even sharp enough to cut the peel. If you cut a “ starter” place for the blade it cuts unevenly, catching parts of the peel in lumps. I bought this to replace a gift ( another make) I had worn out over the years. Will find another. This useless one is going back.
customer_reviews.author: gwyson

customer_reviews.title: Just Like the Old Days
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome; it cranks out apples ready for the instant pot in no time at all! It is sharp and user friendly. I had a little issue getting it to suction yesterday, but I pressed down while flipping the lever and it tightened right up! I got a little complacent with it and it WILL cut you if you aren't paying attention! What I love the most about this product is something I didn't know until after I bought it and used it a few times... This is a business that employs people with disabilities. Let's support this business that it promotes an inclusive and diverse workforce!
customer_reviews.author: shayna dubs

customer_reviews.title: Apple peeler operating
customer_reviews.text: As all new devices you acquire in your life, a little practice goes a long way. The apple peeler works fine, the cutting blade to trim off the peel needs adjusted, and practiced with. This device does not automatically trim off the appeal without a little practice and experimentation. But once you have everything set up it works just fine. We trimmed up a dozen apples for a pie in a matter of minutes. Do not be discouraged at your first Apple.
customer_reviews.author: M. ROSENSTEEL

customer_reviews.title: Good peeler/slicer/corer!
customer_reviews.text: I love using spiralizer-type peelers/slicers/corers. It just saves a lot of time, especially when you want to dehydrate apple slices and need to peel/slice/core a bunch of apples. This product is great, and I really love that I can use it on any flat surface. I have only two small issues with it: the suction only stays on for an apply or two before needing to be re-suctioned (which isn't a big deal), and if you have a bruise (or a softer part) on the apple, the blade has a hard time peeling nicely in that spot. Not big deals, in my opinion. Otherwise, it peels nicely...it cores easily...and it slices like a dream. Can't wait to try peeling potatoes!
customer_reviews.author: Flip

customer_reviews.title: This is JUNK!
customer_reviews.text: I would give this zero starts if I could. I've had several Yankee Peelers, and this is just junk. The shaft is so short that the peeler blade can easily cut your fingers badly when you attach the apple, and you can only attached medium-sized apples. The peeler only peels the first half of the apple, and then gouges the same place over and over until the apple is a mess. It doesn't make even slices; some slices are paper thin and others are the right thickness. The peeler itself is so light weight that even if it worked, it would break within a year of usage. Buy a cast-iron peeler if you plan to do a lot with it.
customer_reviews.author: seabreezecats

customer_reviews.title: Spiralizer is Great and Fun!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to have fun cutting fruits in strings, specially I wanted to try it with Mangoes! In my native country El Salvador it is a cultural thing to buy in the streets “Mango Twist” mango strings in plastic bags with lime juice, hot sauce, salt and our own mixture of a variety of seeds roasted and powdered called “Algüaishte” (a native condiment). Yummy!!! It worked out with a little imagination and I am happy. Next time will try it to do some fancy and fun salads.
customer_reviews.author: JOE LOVENOW

customer_reviews.title: Easier to do it by hand than with this.
customer_reviews.text: I really had high hopes for this. The suction sucks so we don’t use it. We have to cut potatoes in half to fit on this. It doesn’t form properly to the ends of an item so part of it still will have to be peeled by hand. No way I found to remove the option to slice while peeling. These issues mean it actually took longer to peel and cut a potato than it does by hand. Cleaning is difficult. Stuff gets stuck in places that cannot be removed or even moved in order to get tiny pieces of peel out. I love the idea of this but I’m not happy with this particular model.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I've used this on apples as well as potatoes. I will admit that red potatoes didn't work as well but the russets were perfect. The reds were wide and the peeler didn't reach in that far so it was spotty. It was easy to use, easy to clean, the suction doesn't always want to work, but I didn't really try that hard either since I can just hold the thing with one hand and crank with the other. I know it suctioned well the first time I used it when I was super-focused though. Definitely made peeling and slicing russet potatoes way easier, so I finally made potatoes au gratin and they were fantastic!
customer_reviews.author: Deej

customer_reviews.title: My second time around, will update later..
customer_reviews.text: I have to say that I was very impressed with this apple peeler / corer, but to my dismay it broke after three uses. I didn't let it get me down because I had already made 4 baked apples, and I made curly fries, and used the 'core' of the potatoes to make some amazingly wonderful baked potato treats. I did not even contact the company, I just recently ordered another one... It arrived. I hope this one lasts a lot longer.🤔
customer_reviews.author: Kay

customer_reviews.title: Amazing time saver
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised at how well this device worked for me. I’m more of a visual person, so I watched a YouTube video to see how to set it up and operate it. It peeled, sliced, and cored a ton of apples for applesauce. What a great time saver! Worked very well for all of the apples that were firm. The unit did not work as well for the softer, more ripe apples. I’ll be looking forward to seeing how it works for potatoes. A definite plus to anyone who cans, or who wants to save time around the kitchen. An excellent addition to my kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Harpok

customer_reviews.title: keep needing to adjust the screws, no directions how to clean??
customer_reviews.text: I'm not really quite sure what to make of this thing. The concept is nice, it does peel quickly but when you have apples of different sizes, you have to constantly keep readjusting the screws on the coring part and the peeling part. The screw on the coring part has to be super tight, otherwise it will slip in the middle of coring the apple. Only problem is, I need plyers to loosen it again because it needs to be super tight. Also there were ZERO instructions on how to clean this thing. I ended up spot cleaning it, removing the 2 screws and bolts where the peeler and coring part were located.
customer_reviews.author: gojd

customer_reviews.title: Why did I wait so long??
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely 100% love this apple peeler, corer, and slicer! As a mother of 5 and grandmother of 5, I have always made lots of applesauce, apple pie, and apple butter peeling each and every apple by hand. No more! Now I just slip the apple on the 3-prong fork and turn the handle. Within a minute or two the apple is peeled, sliced, and cored. It's easy to wash up and rinse off. I'll be curious to see how long the blades stay sharp but for now I couldn't be happier!
customer_reviews.author: N. Heil

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't hold up
customer_reviews.text: I had a different brand that I used for a long time. It wore out and I had to get a new one. I started out liking it but it has not held out very good. I hardly use it compared to the one before. The blade that cores moves around and I have to hold it in place with one hand to get it to stay in the middle of the apple, which is a pain. The suction isn't very strong, so I have to hold the appliance down. I am having to buy a new one.
customer_reviews.author: R. Macy

customer_reviews.title: Wish I bought this five annual apple pies sooner!
customer_reviews.text: Pros: fun to use, slices and peels asymmetric apples, cores close to the core, peels fast, a million times safer to use, suctioned really well to the counter after I figured out to add a dab of water, and small enough to store easy Cons: if your apples are kinda overripe, you have to catch the spiral before it breaks off and falls onto the counter and into the sink like mine did. Because your slices are thinner, hard to estimate if you're done slicing for a pie because the chunks aren't the size you're used to! 🤣
customer_reviews.author: nikki

customer_reviews.title: Excellent and rapid customer service!
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, I received a lemon! The apple peeler broke on first use and I was really disappointed! I immediately contacted the seller and guess what? I got a response the same day, plus the offer to refund my money or replace the item. I opted for the replacement. This took place on Monday and the replacement was promised for today, Wednesday and lo and behold--it was delivered! I just took it for a trial run, peeling and coring apples. There is definitely a learning curve when it comes to blade placement, but that aside--IT WAS AWESOME! I heartily recommend this product and kudos to a truly responsive customer service team. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Gwen H.

customer_reviews.title: Best one so far!
customer_reviews.text: I just used this for the first time, hoping for something better than my old White Mountain Apple Peeler. It was better! I like the suction base -- worked well on my Formica countertop and didn't shift or move while I peeled the apples. I'd always found previous apple peelers to be frustrating, but this one worked just fine. I used the lever on the peeling blade for adjusting for a larger apple that I was peeling, and it worked well. The cutting blade worked smoothly, and we enjoyed eating the spirals of apple peels that came off with a little apple meat as well. I am so glad I got this! I will use it a lot now.
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn Simpson

customer_reviews.title: Easy and fast apple corer and peeler.
customer_reviews.text: Just received this yesterday and took it out today to clean and try it out. Works fantastic. Flipped the metal bar and it was secure on my counter. Took seconds to peel core and slice my gala apple. The skin shavings had almost no flesh on them and the core function took just what it needed not leaving behind seed etc. Turning was very easy, no muscle needed. After reload from counter and washed. It is small so storing it is easy for quick use. Not sure about longevity of blade but it is replaceable so not an issue.
customer_reviews.author: sewnuts

customer_reviews.title: Box was not even taped shut
customer_reviews.text: The product was shipped with the label carelessly stuck on the product box, the box was not even taped closed. The lid was actually open when we got it out of the mailbox, luckily everything was still inside. The product works as described, the suction cup base held nicely to a marble cutting board, the blade was sharp and made quick work of peeling a bushel of apples. It cleans up easily and quickly and I am happy with the product. I did not appreciate the way that the product was shipped, but I did not feel that the rating I gave the product should be effected because of it.
customer_reviews.author: donna d

customer_reviews.title: Great time saver for us.
customer_reviews.text: Like a few people here I got a dud the first time. I contacted Spiralizer and they promptly replaced it for me. That kind of customer service is rare. I docked 1 star because it can be tricky doing less than perfect apples with bruises or soft spots BUT it is worth to me to not have to hand peel, core, and slice apples. We go through alot of apples my 2 daughters will eat 2 or 3 at a time but only of they are peeled, cored, and sliced thinly- they're 5 and 2 so I'll make the concession to get them to eat fruit. Plus I find myself reaching for an apple more often too.
customer_reviews.author: Katie V.

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as promised!
customer_reviews.text: LIKE: (1) Easy setup, use (strong suction keeps unit in place), and clean-up. I spiralized 3 dozen apples in 15 minutes (in prep for the dehydrator). (2) ALSO... there was a QR code inside the box that offered a free stainless steel julienner/peeler as a thank you gift. The process to claim the free gift was impressively simple (and required the amazon order number to get started). DON’T LIKE: Red. The unit is awesome. I simply would love to see it offered in other colors such as matte black, charcoal, brushed stainless, chrome, olive green, orange, royal, etc.
customer_reviews.author: ZebraCracker

customer_reviews.title: Really reduces prep time!
customer_reviews.text: After a lot of searching the ‘net and asking around, I finally took a chance and ordered this product. It arrived very quickly and well-packaged. I took it out of the box, attached the handle, washed it, put an apple in and, voila, a perfectly cored, peeled, sliced apple. It worked just as described. This product seems very sturdy and really has cut down prep time for apple pies/tarts/ applesauce! I highly recommend it. Have not used it for potatoes yet, but I expect the same good results.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Great peeler and excellent customer service!
customer_reviews.text: I liked this peeler a lot, but unfortunately, a wingnut had been over-tightened, making too hard to remove one of the blades (the one that cuts your whole apple into a spiral as opposed to simply peeling it.) When I told the company about it, they immediately informed me my product came with a lifetime warranty. They apologized for my issue and sent me a new one. They told me I could either keep the one I was dissatisfied with, or give it away. Remarkable service. I love my new peeler and plan to keep it forever! Highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: BonSue

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Horrible. Please read edit.
customer_reviews.text: Edit: I returned the original product. Amazon sent a new one and I received it the next day. This peeler/slicer is much, much better than the first one I had gotten. It does exactly what its described to do, and I'm really happy with the replacement. Thank you Amazon for making this right! Hardly any suction. Prepare yourself, this is going to get away from you. The peeler skips places on the fruit, no matter how much you adjust it. There's no handle at the end, so I turn it where the handle should be. Huge disappointment! Spent money on something that will work better as a bookend. Definitely do not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Colleen Richards

customer_reviews.title: Great except for the suction base
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't get the base to stick to my countertop no matter what I tried, so I ended up having to hold it down. A teeny frustration, but no biggie, I can crank with one hand and hold it with the other. Every now and then the peeling blade needs a little pressure applied to get started, but again, no biggie. I gave it three stars for those reasons
customer_reviews.author: Stacey Bahr

customer_reviews.title: Wife ordered it and she is pleased
customer_reviews.text: The directions are not the easiest (or at least for an old geezer), but I did figure it out. I've only done two apples so far, but it works just like it is supposed to. The peeling of the apple is really neat, and the way it cores the apple is really neat. I like how the apple is spiraled and placing the finished apple on a cutting surface and using a knife to cut down the middle makes it very easy to have eating pieces. I think this thing is pretty slick so far, just need to use it more on other items.
customer_reviews.author: Ex Texan

customer_reviews.title: Love this
customer_reviews.text: We love this. Used it to make crock pot apple crisp and it came out delicious. My mom had one of these when I was growing up and I wanted one. The kids love their apples peeled and spiraled for their school snacks. It’s been easy to use and clean thus far. I just wish it fit back in the box easily for storage
customer_reviews.author: Brian Gadus

customer_reviews.title: How did I do without this???
customer_reviews.text: We actually had an orchard years ago. I can't imagine how many pies my husband would have made if it had been this easy to peel and slice. They dry wonderfully, freeze great, and of course make pies and apple crisp easy. I'm not likely to use it for anything but apples, but it is the best purchase I've made in a while. I have a drawer full of fresh apples from a friend in the fridge right now... pies tomorrow and will freeze the rest.
customer_reviews.author: Anne Applin

customer_reviews.title: Great product for quick and easy Apple peeling
customer_reviews.text: This Apple peeler does a great job at quickly peeling, coring and spiralizing the apples. It is heavy duty and has great suction so that it doesn’t wobble and stays firmly mounted to the countertop. The blade is heavy duty and cuts through even thick skinned apples with ease. It is easy to use and clean. It does better with larger apples and took a little adjustment on the smaller ones to get the peels completely removed. Overall this is a great well made product. I used it to peel over 8 pounds of apples to make applesauce and it made the job quick and easy.
customer_reviews.author: Becky Woods

customer_reviews.title: Good Value, Quality Product
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased a Spiralizer Apple Peeler at the recommendation of a friend. My intent was to buy another from a popular manufacturer, but he recommended otherwise because the Spiralizer is made of more durable and less brittle magnesium, rather than steel or cast iron. I am deeply satisfied with the purchase. It works exactly as intended and I anticipate that it will have a long and highly productive life. I am thankful for a quality product as such things are sometimes difficult to find in a marketplace that cuts corners at the expense of quality and value. I will likely purchase more products from this company in the future. It was received 2 days after being purchased from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: JOHN G REBELO III

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: Easy setup, easy to use, and easy to clean. Saves a lot of time and energy by taking off the apple peel and getting rid of the core at the same time. Also when peeling it does not take too much of the fruit eith the peels. If only this company made more products, they would be a whole lot better than some of the junk we have to buy now. Thanks Bitoni USA and keep up the good work!
customer_reviews.author: William D  Walker

customer_reviews.title: Call me the Applesauce Queen!
customer_reviews.text: Oh my goodness, where have you been all my life!?! For decades I’ve used a hand held vegetable peeler and a knife to peel and core apples for applesauce and pies and just this year decided to purchase this all in one peeler. It is SO much easier. I wish I had purchased this years ago! Now I’m a applesauce makin' fool, making sauce from the Apple tree in my backyard and handing out containers full to friends and family!
customer_reviews.author: CT

customer_reviews.title: Works well when it works
customer_reviews.text: At first this was very easy to use and I liked it. With time, it became very difficult to put the apple on straight. It would go sideways and split. Maybe it was a different variety of apple, although I tried Gala twice. One time it worked and one time it didn’t. I ended up coring and peeling apples for a pie by hand. It was a lot of apples. Also, the screw that holds the corer/slicer was impossible to loosen so I could just peel. I wouldn’t buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Katey11

customer_reviews.title: Came broken
customer_reviews.text: They state "MADE TO LAST - Forged From Ultra-Strong Die Cast Magnesium, not brittle steel for greater stability and strength". The handle was broken when I got it. No idea how long this would last but this doesn't bode well to the rest of it not breaking. Amazon was quick to refund me and I ordered a different brand. I can confirm that it does suction really well on to the counter top though. Really disappointed since it was so highly reviewed.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Durrant

customer_reviews.title: Where have you been all my life!
customer_reviews.text: I've never been a big apple eater; most varieties have a skin that is too thick for my liking. I'm hooked on Honey Crisp but they are not available all the time so with this new toy coring and peeling is more interesting than the Internet. This is well built and a time tested design. Suction mount is excellent. I decided on the cast magnesium vs. cast iron because it is lighter and the casting is better./smoother.
customer_reviews.author: finetunes

customer_reviews.title: WHAT AM I DOING WRONG?
customer_reviews.text: I can't get this one to peel straight or evenly. Yes,I have the apple centered correctly, but unless the apple is absolutely symetrical I wind up hand peeling a lot of apple. Are there areny directions anywhere on how to adjust this expensive metal thing? I have about 30 pounds of apples to peel for applesauce! My last apple peeler was a breeze and did a fabulous job...until I wore it out, unfortunately.
customer_reviews.author: centralohiogal

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.text: It’s apple season! What better time to try this out since were in a pandemic and what else is there to do but bake! I saw someone posted them baking using this on social media so I thought I would try it out myself. I bought a a bag of apples tried it out. It was awesome! I would highly recommend this product especially when you have quite a few apples to peel! It’s really easy to clean and def easy to use!
customer_reviews.author: Josie Heim

customer_reviews.title: Worth the Buy
customer_reviews.text: This is my second one. I have made apple butter every year for the last 20 years and these are great. This year I did 2 bushels of apples and no problem. I have learned over the years that medium apples that are almost perfect works the best. If the apples are lopsided or to big they do not turn right in the peeler. They either tear the apple up or they don't peel it all the way. I would recommend these and save my hands.
customer_reviews.author: Terri

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely fantastic! Peels apples and pears with ease!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely fantastic! I had my doubts, I have seen these around for years and thought they were not worth the money. Fast forward to now, 50 lbs of apples and 25 lbs of pears to prepare for sauce and canning. Hand peeling would take forever. This arrived in the afternoon, it peeled, cored and sliced 50lbs of apples like nothing! Pears I just peeled, screamed through them! Best less than 20bucks I have spent on a kitchen item in some time. Peeling is adjutable, easy to clean, easy to use. Base stays secure and is easily re-seated.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great gadget! Horrible suction.
customer_reviews.text: I love this little gadget! I grew up with on of these and I am excited to have one again. I was excited to have the suction instead of a clamp. It worked okay but it popped off the table almost every apple which was frustrating! If you hold it down with one hand and spin with the other than it is is okay.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie Young

customer_reviews.title: Peeling apples is now a breeze
customer_reviews.text: I had an over abundance of apples this year and decided to try drying some apple slices and canning applesauce. I wouldn't have survived without this peeler. I was able to pump out bags full quickly with the peeler and corer. I love that its easy to change between these two features. The suction has also been shockingly strong and I've never had it slip while using it. So far, I think this works best on apples. Ive tried using it a time or two on potatoes, but because of their varying shape-I've had quite a bit of peel left after sending it through. Money well spent!
customer_reviews.author: nicholas

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and excellent results
customer_reviews.text: I just used this for the first time to peel and slice the apples for an apple crumble. I've never used devices like this before because I didn't have them in my mother's kitchen. I love it? It tool less than a quarter of the time it would have taken to peel, core and slice the apples manually. I really look forward to making more apple desserts all winter. And I will try it on potatoes next.
customer_reviews.author: C. M. Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Where have you been all my life????
customer_reviews.text: I’m in charge of making the mashed potatoes at Thanksgiving, and I HATE how much time it takes to peel and cube the potatoes. This will be a lifesaver for me. I might even consider making mashed potatoes for dinner one night. As soon as I got this, I used it to peel and slice apples for cider. It’s in the pot right now and it smells amazing. I’m making an apple pie for dessert tonight, which I would NEVER do normally, only on special occasions. This thing is the bomb, I’m overwhelmed with the possibilities.
customer_reviews.author: Psprouse

customer_reviews.title: Works Better Than Expected
customer_reviews.text: I am from the land of tasty apples (Washington). It can be pretty cheap to go to the local orchard and pick a big box of apples, but then what do you do with them all? I love slicing and dehydrating them, but it takes forever. I decided to bite the bullet and get this peeler/slicer/corer, and it works way better than I thought. It cranks so smoothly, my three year old can do it. I filled my dehydrator with perfectly even, cored apple slices in a matter of minutes, and now my kitchen will smell like apple-cinnamon for the next 12 hours while the dehydrator works. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Turley

customer_reviews.title: Great peeler
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a way to reduce my peeling time when making apple pies and this is perfect! Not only does it peel and core the apples very well, it also perfectly spiral cuts them evenly so the apples bake evenly in the pie. I did 12 Granny Smith large apples in 8 minutes. It takes longer to set up the apple in the device than it does to actually peel and core it. Love this!
customer_reviews.author: Sheri A.

customer_reviews.title: Great peeler!
customer_reviews.text: The suction works very well on my counters. It can peel and slice apples in seconds. I couldn’t believe how easy and simple it is! I’ll be using this for potatoes as well. Also if you don’t want to peel but you want to slice, it’s easy to take the peeler part off or vice versa. It’s really a great product. I used this to make apple chips in a dehydrator. I’ll be using it soon to make potato chips and potato flour.
customer_reviews.author: kyle

customer_reviews.title: A dream come true for someone who has difficulty swallowing apple peels
customer_reviews.text: I was reluctant to purchase this apple peeler. But I have difficulty swallowing apple peels, probably because of the wax. But even organic, unwaxed apple peels are difficult for me. So I bought this with great skepticism. I am so glad that I was wrong. This is easy to set up. Easy to use. Easy to clean. And has become an important part of my work in the kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: dunsmuirwill

customer_reviews.title: A real time saver!
customer_reviews.text: The reason I have always bought instant potatoes and canned apple pie filling was because of all the time it takes to peel them. Now though, it takes less time to peel, slice and core 5 apples for a dutch apple pie than it does to make the crumble topping. I will also enjoy fried taters and onions more often now too. I mean your ready to fry in less time than it takes for the skillet to heat up. Plus the slices are consistently more even, and I'm not dulling my knives.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Had issues with the first one, but the company made it right!
customer_reviews.text: **Update: reached out to the company and they are sending a new peeler! They’ve been quick to respond and courteous throughout this process. Great customer service! Worked great the 3 times I used it. Attempted to use it this evening and as I was turning the handle it snapped right off. Totally unusable now and unable to return. Wouldn’t recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Peeler Galore
customer_reviews.text: The amount of time saved with the peeler is phenomenal! A 10 lb bag of apples peeled and cored in under 20 minutes! Making pies was a breeze with the peeler - I would recommend any baker to grab one - easy to use and efficient. The only setback which was more of a minor inconvenience was that the suction wasn't the strongest, so I would have to reset it after a few apples, but the amount of time saved was well worth this.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Weissman

customer_reviews.title: Your Search Ends Here
customer_reviews.text: After healthy research into getting a peeler I decided to give this one a try. Just glad it was my first try. I've had it for several weeks now and it leaves nothing wanting, works like a charm, clean up is easy. After my first round with apples and potatoes I was down in the dumps somewhat just thinking of all the time I had wasted over the years peeling with a hand peeler :-( This thing makes short work of peeling and works fairly well on odd shaped potatoes. Heavy construction (I know it will last) Not one complaint, I would recommend buying this item
customer_reviews.author: Mike S

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed, smaller than expected
customer_reviews.text: It is a scaled down compared to an old peeler I have used for years. It only works with small fruits. Apples bigger than a tennis ball the head of the cutter arm makes contact and prevents the blade from reaching. Adjusting blade longer causes it to gouge out a deep cut on the ends where the fruit is smaller diameter with poor results. Does not seem sturdy like older peeler I've had for years.
customer_reviews.author: A + V

customer_reviews.title: A definite must have
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for making apple pies and I can honestly say that it makes peeling, slicing and coring the apples so easy. I will always use this in the future when doing anything that requires peeled and sliced apples. It is so easy to use and I also like that it is possible to change the size of the sliced to whatever you want. I definitely recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Rutley

customer_reviews.title: Love love love!!
customer_reviews.text: I used my Spiralizer apple peeler for the first time this morning and LOVED it. The efficiency of peeling, coring, and slicing all at once with the turn of a handle allowed me to prep apples for applesauce in 10 minutes before work. They are currently cooking in a crockpot and I cannot wait to try the finished product when I get home. I rate the product quality a 5 out of 5! The only negative feedback I have is that the color was a little duller than what it looked like online. I thought it would be a shinier candy apple red and it was more of a flat red. Still love the functionality!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Could be better
customer_reviews.text: This apple peeler is not very good peeling apples. You have to hold the knife part on the apple to peel it because it is not heavy enough with a tight enough spring to hold to the apple. What a mess I had and had to use a knife to clean up every apple I peeled. My suggestion is read all the reviews be fore making a purchase. I suggested this particular peeler to a friend before I used it. Her peeler was broke and never could peel an apples. She sent it back.
customer_reviews.author: Diana Neer

customer_reviews.title: I love this...but some drawbacks
customer_reviews.text: I love that it makes things easier however, -the potato has to be on just right -sometimes the suction cup pops off -cleaning it is a pain. Other than that I love this thing. It saves me so much time. You can just peel, or just slice, or peel and slice. I mainly use this just for peeling and making mashed potatoes.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki

customer_reviews.title: Makes life easier if you don't mind the waste.
customer_reviews.text: I really liked that this saved me time. I was not crazy about how much more it takes away when it's peeling. I am posting a picture of the peelings from the 5 lb bag of red potatoes so you can see how much it peels away. Out of ALL of the potatoes in the 5 lb bag it jammed on me (when trying to wind it forward) about 4 times while peeling the potatoes. It jammed twice while peeling the apples for a pie.
customer_reviews.author: Gammie

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: i received my spiralizer and was impressed how well it was made. The entire function work better than expected, except I did have some problems with the suction holding during the use. After a couple of emails explaining the problem with the manufacturer, I was impressed to see they are customer oriented and really care about their product and their customers, and have offered to send a replacement. Ownership of their product is certainly a refreshing quality to see. Thank you Amazon Seller - Bitoni USA for making things right.
customer_reviews.author: Dottie Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Broke on first use
customer_reviews.text: There a little plastic sleeve holding the arm in place. As I turned the handle, it came out of place and the arm with the apple on it started to wobble. I've since gotten the other apple/peeler/corer available here and it's been much better.
customer_reviews.author: mauldin

customer_reviews.title: Quick for peeling but hard to remove core
customer_reviews.text: This peels my apples at lightning speed - however, the negatives almost outweigh the positives. The apple core is very difficult to remove once you’re done peeling; I’ve hurt my hand multiple times trying to get it off because it’s slippery but won’t come off. It also only suctions to one of the surfaces in my kitchen, my dining room table, and even then it sometimes comes loose without warning.
customer_reviews.author: J B.

customer_reviews.title: A Wonderful Replacement for an item I've used for years
customer_reviews.text: I just received my Apple Peeler. I used it right away on an apple, works great. It was a replacement for another that I had for about 15 years. I hope this one lasts that long--it looks like it will. Now I want to learn about the new things that this one does that my old one didn't, like slicing without peeling. Thanks for making such a nice product.
customer_reviews.author: Prbasha

customer_reviews.title: It does not work well.
customer_reviews.text: The suction power is weak and it takes two people to use it. If the fruit is not perfectly shaped it doesn’t peel properly. The parts that do the peeling don’t stay tight, in general it is not a very good item. I threw it away .
customer_reviews.author: Treaty

customer_reviews.title: works very well saves time
customer_reviews.text: The apple peeler works very well. We were able to quickly peel a peck of apples in verry little time after adjusting the cutting are to the desiredcutting depth. The blades are sharp and the suction of the base works perfectly. The only problem we had is the wing nut and screw holding the coring/ slicing blade in place is slightly stripped making it difficult to adjust. A trip to the hardware store will solve.
customer_reviews.author: JAS

customer_reviews.title: First of this type that actually works well
customer_reviews.text: Have bought a few of these in the past and been disappointed with almost every aspect of their operation. This one actually works well. Not perfect, never can be with the odd shapes of different apples, sweet potatoes, etc. Warning with apples: Once they are even ever so slightly soft, the core can spin inside the apple.
customer_reviews.author: Angela W

customer_reviews.title: Huge time saver
customer_reviews.text: I never read the instructions. ( I recommend everyone do) I had an apple done within minutes of opening. Super easy to use and if you have ever had to do a lot of apples, it turns a big job into a small one. It didn’t move on my clean “non-porous” counter. Great! It did hang up on a soft spot but that would be a defect in the apple not the peeler.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good product.
customer_reviews.text: The spiralizer was very easy to figure out, put together and use. The only problem was the suction on the bottom of the device. It didn’t want to sit still. I tried it on a few different surfaces. It would suction an release when I started to peel and cut the apple. I am still very satisfied with the product. I’ve used it a couple of times now.
customer_reviews.author: Kay Zaleski

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic fresh apple slices.
customer_reviews.text: I love this. When I bought it my son who is a chef laughed because I had never seen one before. He said this is old fashion. I love fresh apples but am afraid of hurting my partial denture.This cuts them into thin spirally curly slices. Oh I just love it. I have used it on pears also. I am going to use it to spiral zucchini also.
customer_reviews.author: Norma S

customer_reviews.title: TEN stars for quality and a gift of HEALTH!!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE LOVE LOVE this gadget! I have made pounds and pounds of dried apple slices (Honey Crisp are the best to use, easiest to peel with this gadget and sweetest!) and it’s so fun and easy that I can do 9 dehydrator trays in TEN MINUTES. Can you believe that??? All of my fourteen grandkids love the dried apples as snacks, even more than CANDY and they are so healthy!! Ten Stars if I could rate that high!!
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Homemade Baby Apple/Pear Sauce in a Breeze!
customer_reviews.text: Life with a. just about walking on his own, 11 month old is hectic enough. Having to peal, core, and slice apples/pears for homemade baby food had become a burden. I figured there was an easier way to complete the task at hand. After some searching I found the Spiralizer Apple Peeler. Bought it and within 2 days (Amazon Prime Membership) we received it. Took it out of the box, washed it down, and suctioned it to the countertop. Within 10 minutes I had a 5 lb. bag of apples peeled, cored, and sliced. Making the rest of my process easier. I’m glad I found this kitchen utensil when I did, we’re going to need it the coming weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Eric N.

customer_reviews.title: Good suction, light frame.
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t had a chance to use this yet, I will on Sunday. However, I bought it as a replacement for my old one, which I love. This one is very light in comparison, which makes me a little apprehensive. I will update when I use it. The suction seemed to work well when I tested it. So it stands to reason that this will work just as well, I look forward to trying it.
customer_reviews.author: Chantel Ivy

customer_reviews.title: Mostly works
customer_reviews.text: The product seems to be well made, the suction holds tight, then lets go from time to time, just restick it and good to go. It cores and slices very nicely, however I can't get the peeler to work right, went through a 1/2 bushel of apples in no time. Found that I could hand peel, core and slice 24 apples in 45 min.. I really like this little gadget.
customer_reviews.author: LadyBell

customer_reviews.title: Works slick!
customer_reviews.text: Love these apple peelers! Have started giving these as gifts now, as we have used one for 3 years and it still works perfectly. My hubby is an apple pie lover, so he's always happy to do the peeling and I can hardly get the pie crust ready before he has a whole bowl of apples ready for me!! The slices come out fairly thin so cook well whether piled in a pie or in little tarts.
customer_reviews.author: jncporter

customer_reviews.title: Awesome kitchen gadget!
customer_reviews.text: I have a plethora of kitchen gadgets. This apple corer/peeler/spiraler is one of my favorite. I used to dread apple season because of the tedious work, but now I can peel, core, and spiral apples in no time- and the consistency of the spiral makes my pies and crisps better (and the perfect thickness for drying apples).
customer_reviews.author: Super Mom

customer_reviews.title: Worth its weight in gold...
customer_reviews.text: Got this peeler after spending two full days peeling, coring, and slicing small homegrown apples for pies and butter and such. My wrists still hurt, and that was over a week ago. This peeler is easy to use, works like a charm, and the bonus is the GF loves spiral cut fried potatoes and I didn't realize that this peeler can do that function as well!
customer_reviews.author: Caleb

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to try this out that as soon as it came in we opened it cleaned it and tried out a apple at first I didn’t get it right it didn’t peel the apple but then we got it on the 2nd try and my kids love the way it cuts the apple my kids hate the skin and obviously the core using this is supper fast and easy!! We are now trying out potatoes and to throw in the fryer and have a little snack! We love it
customer_reviews.author: Tiffaine Cataldo

customer_reviews.title: Takes the chore out of apple and potato peeling
customer_reviews.text: I bought this knowing I would be baking a lot with smaller apples that would be knuckle scraping chores without it. It worked well and cut very uniform slices. It was simple enough for me to include my child too (supervised because of the sharpness of the corer and peeler). It was easy to clean - Quick hot water spray down from the faucet was all it needed to rinse the sticky apple juices away. I hadn’t even thought to use it with potatoes. Next time I make au gratin or skillet potatoes I’ll be seeing how it works for that!
customer_reviews.author: MN Elkhound

customer_reviews.title: i mean, i guess it works ok. it ...
customer_reviews.text: i mean, i guess it works ok. it doesn't work for potatoes at all unless you want to spiralize and core them and it makes a big mess. my family doesn't consume enough peeled apple products to justify the space it takes up to store it. i don't know what i was thinking in buying it. edit* i updated the rating as i don't want to harm an american business. the product works as advertised and is very sturdy and well built, i just wasn't actually needing it for my household.
customer_reviews.author: mizztanya

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: A great product. Was using a very old cast iron peeler, that clamped on to the table/counter, and it was very hard to use. i did probably a bushel of apples in a couple of hours. And it saved my hands/fingers - peeling and paring is getting harder with my arthritis.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does what it should
customer_reviews.text: I had one of these years ago and decided I needed another one. I recently made a few pints of apple butter and this peeled, cored and slice my apples effortlessly. Suction was great, it never moved. I haven’t tried it with potatoes so I can’t comment on how well it works with those but with apples it works great. I am please with my choice.
customer_reviews.author: Leanne

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, solid and cleanup is simple
customer_reviews.text: Very solid and well made product. I used this to peel and slice 1/2 a bushel of apples To make applesauce. The peeler/slicer is so easy to use and cleanup is a snap. Going to try and make cucumber swirls to snack on tomorrow. So many possibilities besides just an apple peeler. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Joan L. Marshall

customer_reviews.title: Simple and no batteries required
customer_reviews.text: Really fun way to eat apples, I eat so many more now because I’m a big baby when it comes to eating to skin. Follow the instructions. It’s hard to figure out if you hate reading instructions like me beware to get frustrated. I’m not sure if it dishwasher safe but I just rinse it off to not let juices sit. Overall good protect for the money. Suction cup and lever mechanism could be improved.
customer_reviews.author: hannah lane

customer_reviews.title: A must have for making large batches of applesauce or pies
customer_reviews.text: This was such a helpful tool for peeling and cutting many pounds of apples for canning applesauce. Due to inconsistent size and shape of the apples, I sometimes had to go over apples afterwards with a peeler, but this tool saved so much time and sore writs. I may by another one to get the family involved and save more time.
customer_reviews.author: AFP

customer_reviews.title: Old design that would be hard to improve
customer_reviews.text: We ordered the item one afternoon and the next night I was peeling an apple with it! This little apparatus is so simple to use and quite entertaining, and it prepares the apple for shared consumption, would not want to be without one. I did not give it 5 stars because as great as it is , in my opinion nothing is perfect!
customer_reviews.author: rojca

product_meta.title: Cast Magnesium Apple/Potato Peeler Corer by Spiralizer, Durable Heavy Duty Die Cast Magnesium Alloy Peelers
feature_bullets: MADE TO LAST - Forged From Ultra-Strong Die Cast Magnesium, not brittle steel for greater stability and strength
THE HIGHEST QUALITY - Rust-proof Chrome Plated Winding Rod and 3 prong extension with safety cap. Stainless Steel Blades and Chrome Plated Parts and Poly Handle
EASY TO USE - Powerful Rubber Vacuum Base holds onto tabletop for tremendous stability. Excellent peeler for seniors and those with arthritis
VERSATILE - Slices, Cores and Peels Tomatoes, Fruits, Apples and Potatoes. Easy to Wash and Clean Fruit Knife

LIVE FRIENDLY CUSTOMER SUPPORT & LIFETIME WARRANTY - All of our Spiralizer products are backed by real live Customer Support. Our friendly team in Cheyenne is here for whatever you need. You are also covered by our Spiralizer lifetime no-hassle replacement policy.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars4,956 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
